intro: Senecio arabicus, commonly known as the Arabian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot climates. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by green bracts, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Senecio arabicus is often found in open habitats such as deserts and coastal areas.
